ai.summary: Carn Brea FP 33 is an ultra-short, easy hike in the UK. The route spans about 0.1 km and is suitable for all ages, offering a gentle stroll along a well-maintained public footpath with straightforward navigation and light scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily flat to gently sloped surface on a public footpath. Surfaces include compacted earth, gravel and short grassy sections, with a few small steps near viewpoints. Generally well-maintained; watch for uneven patches after adverse weather.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast before you go, as conditions can change quickly. Wear sturdy footwear and stay on the marked path. Avoid climbing walls or ruins and keep a safe distance from any cliff edges. Supervise children and keep dogs on a short leash where required. Bring a charged phone and basic essentials for a very short walk.
recommended_gear: Weather protection (rain jacket, hat, sunglasses as needed)
Phone with charged battery or offline map
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with the most pleasant conditions in spring and autumn; in winter be prepared for cold, wet or icy surfaces.
